'/../../db/db_handler.php');\nrequire_once(__DIR__ . '/../../util/util.php');\n\n$table = json_decode(file_get_contents('php://input'), true)['id'];\n?&gt;\n\n&lt;html&gt;\n&lt;table class=&quot;table table-bordered table-sm&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;thead class=&quot;thead-dark&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;tr&gt;\n        &lt;th style=&quot;width: 2%&quot; scope=&quot;col&quot;&gt;#&lt;/th&gt;\n        &lt;th style=&quot;width: 15%&quot; scope=&quot;col&quot;&gt;Street&lt;/th&gt;\n        &lt;th style=&quot;width: 10%&quot; scope=&quot;col&quot;&gt;Phone&lt;/th&gt;\n        &lt;th style=&quot;width: 10%&quot; scope=&quot;col&quot;&gt;Date&lt;/th&gt;\n        &lt;th style=&quot;width: 15%&quot; scope=&quot;col&quot;&gt;Price&lt;/th&gt;\n        &lt;th style=&quot;width: 38%&quot; scope=&quot;col&quot;&gt;Comment&lt;/th&gt;\n        &lt;th style=&quot;width: 10%&quot; scope=&quot;col&quot;&gt;Operator&lt;/th&gt;\n        &lt;th style=&quot;width: 10%&quot; scope=&quot;col&quot;&gt;Worker&lt;/th&gt;\n    &lt;/tr&gt;\n    &lt;/thead&gt;\n\n    &lt;tbody&gt;\n\n    &lt;?php\n    $stmt = $connection-&gt;prepare(&quot;SELECT * FROM `&quot; . $table . &quot;` ORDER BY `date` ASC&quot;);\n    $stmt-&gt;execute();\n    $result = $stmt-&gt;get_result();\n\n\n\n    while ($row = $result-&gt;fetch_array()) {\n        $tr_id = $table . $row['id'];\n\n        echo '&lt;tr&gt;';\n        echo '&lt;th class=&quot;align-middle&quot; scope=&quot;row&quot;&gt;' . $row['id'] . '&lt;/td&gt;';\n\n        if (!isset($row['worker'])) {\n            echo '&lt;td&gt;' . '&lt;button type=&quot;button&quot; class=&quot;btn btn-primary btn-sm&quot;&gt;Accept&lt;/button&gt;' . '&lt;/td&gt;';\n        } else {\n            echo '&lt;td&gt;' . $row['worker'] . '&lt;/td&gt;';\n        }\n\n        echo '&lt;/tr&gt;';\n    }\n    ?&gt;\n\n    &lt;/tbody&gt;\n&lt;/table&gt;\n&lt;/html&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p>And here is my page with <code>Tabs</code>:</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;div class=&quot;tab-pane show&quot; {"body":"<p>I've run into a problem using <code>chartjs-plugin-annotations</code> in a Vue.js application</p>\n<p>We've been successfully embedding ChartJS charts in our Vue applications for a while with the <code>config</code> for the chart defined in the <code>data ()</code> section of the components.</p>\n<p>However when we have added in the <code>chartjs-plugin-annotation</code> plugin we have been unable to get the annotations working unless we define the config locally and return the <code>new Chart</code> directly. This obviously causes problems with updating the chart.</p>\n<p>This is the basic model we are using with Annotations</p>\n<pre><code>  async setChart (ctx) {\n   const config = {\n     type: 'bar',\n     data: {},\n       ..      \n   }\n   // populate the dateset for the chart\n   await this.setChartData(config)\n   // populate the annotations for the chart\n   await this.setAnnotations(config)\n   // create the chart\n   return new Chart(ctx, config)\n }\n</code></pre>\n<p>A full example fiddle is <a href=\"https://codesandbox.io/s/naughty-wave-yiq42?file=/src/components/ChartTest.vue:3572-4709\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">here</a></p>\n<p>This is fine (or at least works) when we are using the charts statically however we have at least page where we need to change the chart depending on selections on the page. In this instance the <code>new Chart</code> is rendering the new data but keeping the old chart as well. The browser then flicks between charts when moused over. This can be seen in the example above.</p>\n<p>Ideally we should be using the <code>update()</code> method of chartJS in this case, but as we are not assigning the chart to a global we cannot access it after creation</p>\n<p>Any thoughts?</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":193,"question_id":65022623,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I want to dynamically hide a series from the chart if the value of that series is 0 for that particular year.</p>\n<p>So from the below chart you can see that in year 2020 and above i don't have the actual value so i don't want to show a gap there between both the series</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/ZAVnB.png\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/ZAVnB.png\" alt=\"enter image description here\" /></a></p>\n<p>I tried the below code but it hides all the year actual values. I only want if actual value is 0 then dont leave a gap between underwriting and grills</p>\n<pre><code> public seriesRender(args: ISeriesRenderEventArgs ): void {\n     for (const key in args.data) {\n       if (Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty.call(args.data, key)) {\n         const element = args.data[key];         \n         if(element.actual == 0 &amp;&amp; args.series.name == 'Actual'){\n          args.series.chart.visibleSeries.forEach(element =&gt; {\n            if(element.name == 'Actual')\n            element.visible = false;\n          });\n         }\n       }\n     }\n  }\n</code></pre>\n<p>HTML :</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;e-series-collection&gt;\n      &lt;e-series [animation]=&quot;animation&quot; [dataSource]='chartData' type='Column' xName='year' yName='underwriting' [name]='underwritingLabel' [marker]='marker'&gt;&lt;/e-series&gt;\n      &lt;e-series [animation]=&quot;animation&quot; [dataSource]='chartData' type='Column' xName='year' yName='actual' name='Actual' == 0&quot; [marker]='marker'&gt;&lt;/e-series&gt;\n      &lt;e-series [animation]=&quot;animation&quot; [dataSource]='chartData' type='Column' xName='year' yName='grills' name='Grills' [marker]='marker'&gt;&lt;/e-series&gt;\n    &lt;/e-series-collection&gt;\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":195,"question_id":65022611,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>ES2020 introduced the <strong>nullish coalescing operator (<code>??</code>)</strong> which returns the right operand if the left operand is null or undefined. This functionality is similar to the <strong>logical OR operator (<code>||</code>)</strong>. For example, the below expressions return the same results.</p>\n<pre><code>const a = undefined\nconst b = &quot;B&quot;\n\nconst orOperator = a || b\nconst nullishOperator = a ?? b\n  \nconsole.log({ orOperator, nullishOperator })\n</code></pre>\n<p>result:</p>\n<pre><code>{\n    orOperator:&quot;B&quot;,\n    nullishOperator:&quot;B&quot;\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>So how is the <strong>nullish operator</strong> different and what is its use case?</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":201,"question_id":65022531,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

This can happen when a component repeatedly calls setState inside componentWillUpdate or componentDidUpdate. React limits the number of nested updates to prevent infinite loops.</p>\n</blockquote>\n<p>This is how I am trying to do .</p>\n<pre><code>    class DispensingIncidents extends React.Component {\n  constructor(props) {\n    super(props);\n    this.state = {\n      timeSpan: &quot;&quot;,\n      year: 2020,\n      tabValue: &quot;&quot;,\n      spanData: [],\n      dataType: &quot;&quot;,\n      durationList: &quot;&quot;,\n      durationLabel: &quot;&quot;,\n      dataTo: &quot;&quot;,\n      dataFrom: &quot;&quot;,\n      incidencesSection: false,\n      overViewSelect: &quot;&quot;,\n      selectTab: 0,\n    };\n  }\n\n  componentDidMount() {\n    this.props.getFilterData(this.state.year);\n    this.props.getDuration(this.state.year);\n  }\n\n  componentDidUpdate(prevProps, prevState, snapshot) {\n    if (\n      prevProps.dispensingData.duration !== this.props.dispensingData.duration\n    ) {\n      this.props.getOverviewData(\n        Object.keys(this.props.dispensingData.period)[3],\n        this.props.dispensingData.duration.monthly[0].period.to,\n        this.props.dispensingData.duration.monthly[0].period.from,\n        Object.keys(this.props.dispensingData.type)[0],\n        this.props.dispensingData._reference\n      );\n      this.setState({\n        timeSpan: Object.keys(this.props.dispensingData.period)[3],\n        dataType: Object.keys(this.props.dispensingData.type)[0],\n      });\n    }\n  }\n  componentWillReceiveProps() {    &lt; {"body":"<p>I'm trying to make a call from client side(browser) to FreeSWITCH server using this libs:</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://sipjs.com/\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">Sip.js</a></p>\n<p><a href=\"https://github.com/onsip/SIP.js/blob/master/docs/api.md\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">Sip.js framework</a></p>\n<p>And also I use React.</p>\n<p>When I make a call I successfully invite destination URI.</p>\n<p>After click button and call function callSip our SessionState changes to Ringing, then successful invitation, then SessionState is &quot;Answered&quot; and after that the function onAccept in requestDelegate object is run, but no connection is established because the SessionState goes to &quot;Ended&quot;</p>\n<p>After all I have this log.</p>\n<p>How to establish a voice connection so that it does not break off after receiving a call?\nHow to add a remote sound from sip to an audio ref element?</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/ddjgn.png\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/ddjgn.png\" alt=\"Invite Log\" /></a>\n<a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/4R0Ol.png\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/4R0Ol.png\" alt=\"BYE LOG\" /></a></p>\n<pre><code>const CallList: React.FC&lt;Props&gt; = (props) =&gt; {\n  const [userURI, setUserURI] = useState&lt;URI | null&gt;(null);\n  const audioRef = useRef(null);\n\n  useEffect(() =&gt; {\n    const uri = UserAgent.makeURI(&quot;sip:9012@serverpoint&quot;);\n    if (!uri) {\n      throw new Error(&quot;Failed to create URI&quot;);\n    }\n    setUserURI(uri);\n    return () =&gt; {\n      console.log(&quot;unmount&quot;);\n    };\n  }, []);\n\n  if (!userURI) {\n    return &lt;div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;;\n  }\n\n  const userAgentOptions: UserAgentOptions = {\n    uri: userURI,\n    authorizationPassword: &quot;pasw&quot;,\n    authorizationUsername: &quot;9012&quot;,\n    transportOptions: {\n      server: &quot;ws://serverpoint&quot;,\n    },\n  };\n\n  const userAgent = new UserAgent(userAgentOptions);\n  const target = UserAgent.makeURI(&quot;sip:9005@serverpoint&quot;);\n  const session = new Inviter(userAgent, target as URI);\n\n  // Setup session state change handler\n  session.stateChange.addListener((newState: SessionState) =&gt; {\n    switch (newState) {\n      case SessionState.Establishing:\n        alert(&quot;Ringing&quot;);\n        break;\n      case SessionState.Established:\n        alert(&quot;Answered&quot;);\n        break;\n      case SessionState.Terminated:\n        alert(&quot;Ended&quot;);\n        break;\n    }\n  });\n\n  // Options including delegate to capture response messages\n  const inviteOptions: InviterInviteOptions = {\n    requestDelegate: {\n      onAccept: (response) =&gt; {\n        console.log(response.message);\n        alert(&quot;Positive response&quot;);\n        console.log(&quot;Positive response = &quot; + response);\n      },\n      onReject: (response) =&gt; {\n        console.log(&quot;Negative response = &quot; + response);\n      },\n    },\n    sessionDescriptionHandlerOptions: {\n      constraints: {\n        audio: true,\n        video: false,\n      },\n    },\n  };\n\n  const callSIP = () =&gt; {\n    session\n      .invite(inviteOptions)\n      .then((request: OutgoingInviteRequest) =&gt; {\n        alert(&quot;Successfully sent INVITE&quot;);\n        alert(&quot;INVITE request = &quot; + request);\n      })\n      .catch((error: Error) =&gt; {\n        console.log(&quot;Failed to send INVITE&quot;);\n      });\n  };\n\n\n  const stop = () =&gt;\n    setTimeout(() =&gt; {\n      userAgent\n        .stop()\n        .then(() =&gt; {\n          console.log(&quot;Stopped&quot;);\n        })\n        .catch((error) =&gt; {\n          console.error(&quot;Failed to stop&quot;);\n        });\n    }, 5000);\n\n  userAgent\n    .start()\n    .then(() =&gt; {\n      console.log(&quot;Connected&quot;);\n      const registerer = new Registerer(userAgent);\n      registerer.stateChange.addListener((newStat) =&gt; {\n        console.log(newStat);\n        // switch (newState) {\n        //   case RegistererState.Registered:\n        //     console.log(&quot;Registered&quot;);\n        //     break;\n        //   case RegistererState.Unregistered:\n        //     console.log(&quot;Unregistered&quot;);\n        //     break;\n        //   case RegistererState.Terminated:\n        //     console.log(&quot;Terminated&quot;);\n        //     break;\n        // }\n      });\n      registerer\n        .register()\n        .then((request) =&gt; {\n          alert(&quot;Successfully sent REGISTER&quot;);\n          alert(&quot;Sent request = &quot; + request);\n        })\n        .catch((error) =&gt; {\n          console.error(&quot;Failed to send REGISTER&quot;);\n        });\n\n      if (registerer.state === &quot;Registered&quot;) {\n        // Currently registered\n        alert(&quot;Registered&quot;);\n      }\n      // stop();\n    })\n    .catch((error) =&gt; {\n      console.error(&quot;Failed to connect&quot;);\n    });\n\n  const panes = [\n    {\n      menuItem: &quot;Calls&quot;,\n      render: () =&gt; (\n        &lt;Tab.Pane loading={false}&gt;\n          &lt;List celled&gt;\n            &lt;List.Item&gt;\n              &lt;audio ref={audioRef} id=&quot;remote-audio&quot;&gt;&lt;/audio&gt;\n            &lt;/List.Item&gt;\n            {props.data.map((item) =&gt; (\n              &lt;List.Item key={v4()} onClick={callSIP}&gt;\n                &lt;Image avatar src=&quot;&quot; /&gt;\n                &lt;List.Content&gt;\n                  &lt;List.Header&gt;\n                    {item.location} - {item.number}\n                  &lt;/List.Header&gt;\n                  {item.timestamp}\n                &lt;/List.Content&gt;\n                &lt;List.Content floated=&quot;right&quot;&gt;\n                  &lt;Button&gt;Call&lt;/Button&gt;\n                &lt;/List.Content&gt;\n              &lt;/List.Item&gt;\n            ))}\n          &lt;/List&gt;\n        &lt;/Tab.Pane&gt;\n      ),\n    },\n    {\n      menuItem: &quot;tab 2&quot;,\n      render: () =&gt; &lt;Tab.Pane&gt;Tab 2 Content&lt;/Tab.Pane&gt;,\n    },\n  ];\n\n  return (\n    &lt;Container&gt;\n      &lt;Tab panes={panes} /&gt;\n    &lt;/Container&gt;\n  );\n};\n\nexport default CallList;\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":217,"question_id":65022259,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

    \n    &lt;div id=&quot;patientDetails&quot; style=&quot;display:none&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;    \n    &lt;/div&gt;\n    &lt;c:if test=&quot;${not empty noAppt }&quot;&gt;\n        &lt;span&gt;${noAppt }&lt;/span&gt;\n    &lt;/c:if&gt;\n\n&lt;/body&gt;\n&lt;/html&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p><strong>JS PAGE</strong></p>\n<pre><code>$(document).ready(function(){\n    \n    //Stops the submit request\n    $(&quot;#form&quot;).submit(function(e){\n        e.preventDefault();\n    });\n\n    //checks for the button click event\n    $(&quot;.mybtn&quot;).click(function(e){  \n        \n        //get the form data and then serialize that\n        dataString=$(&quot;form&quot;).serialize();\n\n        //make the AJAX request, dataType is set to json\n        //meaning we are expecting JSON data in response from the server\n        $.ajax({\n            type: &quot;Post&quot;,\n            url: &quot;/Doctor_Appointment_Application/Login&quot;,\n            data: dataString,\n            dataType: &quot;json&quot;,\n            \n            //if received a response from the server\n            success: function(data,textStatus,jqXHR){\n                //doc Name was correct so we have some information to display   \n                    $(&quot;#patientDetails&quot;).show(500);\n                    $(data.pDetails).each(function(index,item){\n                        var img=document.createElement('img');\n                        \n                        img.src=item.userImage;\n                        img.className+=&quot;image&quot;;\n                        \n                        $(&quot;#patientDetails&quot;).append(img);\n                        $(&quot;#patientDetails&quot;).append(&quot;&lt;b&gt;Full Name:&lt;/b&gt; + textStatus);\n                },\n                \n                beforeSend: function(jqXHR, settings){\n                    //adding some Dummy data to the request\n                    settings.data += &quot;&amp;dummyData=whatever&quot;;\n                    //disable the button until we get the response\n                    $('.mybtn').attr(&quot;disabled&quot;, true);\n                },\n                \n                //this is called after the response or error functions are finsihed\n                //so that we can take some action\n                complete: function(jqXHR, textStatus){\n                     \n                    $('.mybtn').attr(&quot;disabled&quot;, true);\n                }\n            }); \n     });\n});\n</code></pre>\n<p><strong>CSS PAGE</strong></p>\n<pre><code>* {\n    box-sizing: border-box;\n    margin: 0px;\n    padding: 0px;\n}\n\nbody {\n    font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; {"body":"<p>I want to create a video chat app. But My app is not showing others participate video. Please help. When others participate joined. It doesn't show his video on my window.  Here is my code. Thanks in advance.</p>\n<p>Here is the code for the server.\nServer.js -</p>\n<pre><code>    const express = require('express');\n    \n    const app = express();\n    const server = require('http').Server(app);\n    const io = require('socket.io')(server)\n    const { v4: uuidV4 } = require('uuid')\n    const { ExpressPeerServer } = require('peer');\n    const peerServer = ExpressPeerServer(server,{\n      debug: true\n    })\n    \n    app.set('view engine', 'ejs')\n    app.use(express.static('public'))\n    \n    app.use('/peerjs', peerServer)\n    \n    app.get('/', (req,res)=&gt;{\n      res.redirect(`/${uuidV4()}`)\n    })\n    \n    \n    app.get('/:room', (req, res) =&gt; {\n      res.render('room', { roomId: req.params.room })\n    })\n    \n    \n    io.on('connection',socket =&gt;{\n      socket.on('join-room',(roomId, userId)=&gt;{\n        socket.join(roomId);\n        socket.to(roomId).broadcast.emit('user-connected', userId);\n      })\n    })\n\n\nserver.listen(process.env.PORT || 3030);\n</code></pre>\n<p>It is the main script.\nScript.js-</p>\n<pre><code>const socket = io('/')\n\nconst videoGrid = document.getElementById('video_grid')\n\nlet myVideoStream;\nconst myVideo = document.createElement('video')\nmyVideo.muted = true;\n\nvar peer = new Peer(undefined, {\n  path: '/peerjs',\n  host: '/',\n  port: '3030'\n}); \n\nnavigator.mediaDevices.getUserMedia({\n  video: true,\n  audio: true\n}).then(stream =&gt; {\n  myVideoStream = stream;\n  addVideoStream(myVideo, stream)\n\n  peer.on('call', call=&gt;{\n    call.answer(stream)\n    const video = document.createElement('video')\n    call.on('stream', userVideoStream=&gt;{\n      addVideoStream(video, userVideoStream)\n      \n    })\n  })\n\n  socket.on('user-connected', userId =&gt;{\n    connecToNewUSer(userId, stream);\n    alert('Somebody connect', userId)\n    \n  })\n  \n}\n)\n  peer.on('open', id =&gt;{\n    socket.emit('join-room', ROOM_ID, id) ;\n  })\n   \n\n  \n\n\n  const connecToNewUSer = (userId, stream) =&gt; {\n    const call = peer.call(userId, stream)\n    const video = document.createElement('video')\n    call.on('stream', userVideoStream =&gt;{\n      addVideoStream(video, userVideoStream)\n      \n    }) \n  }\n\n  \n\n  function addVideoStream(video, stream) {\n    video.srcObject = stream\n    video.addEventListener('loadedmetadata', () =&gt; {\n      video.play()\n    })\n    videoGrid.append(video)\n  }\n</code></pre>\n<p>It is the ejs file.\nroom.ejs -</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;!DOCTYPE html&gt;\n&lt;html lang=&quot;en&quot;&gt;\n&lt;head&gt;\n  &lt;meta charset=&quot;UTF-8&quot;&gt;\n  &lt;meta name=&quot;viewport&quot; content=&quot;width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0&quot;&gt;\n  &lt;title&gt;ZOOM&lt;/title&gt;\n  &lt;script src=&quot;/socket.io/socket.io.js&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n  &lt;script src=&quot;https://unpkg.com/peerjs@1.3.1/dist/peerjs.min.js&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n  &lt;script&gt;\n    const ROOM_ID = &quot;&lt;%= roomId %&gt;&quot;\n  &lt;/script&gt;\n  &lt;link rel=&quot;stylesheet&quot; {"body":"<p>I'm using <strong>Fabric J</strong>S. Every time I press the <code>Add Door</code> button it creates on the upper left. I gave the values ​​in the rectangle (left: 40, top: 40,).\nHowever, when I press the button while I am on the area I zoomed, I want it to add it to the area I zoomed. I looked at a few examples but could not find what I wanted. How can I do that?</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://streamable.com/lev6qr\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">Video</a></p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>var canvas = new fabric.Canvas('c');\ncanvas.setBackgroundImage('https://i.hizliresim.com/0pIPiv.jpg', canvas.renderAll.bind(canvas));\nvar uniqids = 0;\n$(\"#door\").on(\"click\", function(e) {\n  rect = new fabric.Rect({\n    id:uniqid,\n    left: 40,\n    top: 40,\n    width: 35,\n    height: 50,      \n    fill: 'blue',\n    stroke: 'blue',\n    strokeWidth: 5,\n    strokeUniform: false,\n    hasControls : true,\n  });  \n\n  var uniqid = uniqids.toString(); \n\n  var text = new fabric.Text(uniqid, {\n    fontSize: 30,\n    originX: 'center',\n    originY: 'right'\n  });\n\n  var group = new fabric.Group([ rect, text ], {\n    left: 0,\n    top: 100,\n  });\n\n  canvas.add(group);\n  uniqids++;\n\n  canvas.on('selection:cleared', c =&gt; {\n    console.log(\"empty\");\n  });\n  canvas.selection = false;\n\n});\n//*****************************\n// canvas.on('mouse:wheel', function(opt) {\n//   var delta = opt.e.deltaY;\n//   var zoom = canvas.getZoom();\n//   zoom *= 0.999 ** delta;\n//   if (zoom &gt; 20) zoom = 20;\n//   if (zoom &lt; 0.01) zoom = 0.01;\n//   canvas.setZoom(zoom);\n//   opt.e.preventDefault();\n//   opt.e.stopPropagation();\n\n// })\n\n$('#getid').click(function() {\n  var activeObject = canvas.getActiveObjects();\n  alert(canvas.getActiveObject().id); \n});\n\n\n\n//***************************************\n\n$(\"#save\").on(\"click\", function(e) {\n  $(\".save\").html(canvas.toSVG());\n});\n\n$('#delete').click(function() {\n  var activeObject = canvas.getActiveObjects(); \n  canvas.discardActiveObject();\n  canvas.remove(...activeObject); \n});\n\n\n$(\"#btnResetZoom\").on(\"click\", function(e) {\n  canvas.setViewportTransform([1,0,0,1,0,0]);\n});\n\ncanvas.on('mouse:wheel', function(opt) {\n    var delta = opt.e.deltaY;\n    var zoom = canvas.getZoom();\n    zoom *= 0.999 ** delta;\n    if (zoom &gt; 20) zoom = 20;\n    if (zoom &lt; 1) zoom = 1;\n    canvas.zoomToPoint({x: opt.e.offsetX, y: opt.e.offsetY}, zoom);\n    opt.e.preventDefault();\n    opt.e.stopPropagation();\n});\nvar shiftKeyDown = true;\nvar mouseDownPoint = null;\ncanvas.on('mouse:move', function(options) {\n  if (shiftKeyDown &amp;&amp; mouseDownPoint) {\n    var pointer = canvas.getPointer(options.e, true);\n    var mouseMovePoint = new fabric.Point(pointer.x, pointer.y);\n    canvas.relativePan(mouseMovePoint.subtract(mouseDownPoint));\n    mouseDownPoint = mouseMovePoint;\n    keepPositionInBounds(canvas);\n  }\n});\n\n\n\n\nvar Direction = {\n  LEFT: 0,\n  UP: 1,\n  RIGHT: 2,\n  DOWN: 3\n};\n\nvar zoomLevel = 0;\nvar zoomLevelMin = 0;\nvar zoomLevelMax = 3;\n\nvar shiftKeyDown = false;\nvar mouseDownPoint = null;\n\ncanvas.on('mouse:down', function(options) {\n  var pointer = canvas.getPointer(options.e, true);\n  mouseDownPoint = new fabric.Point(pointer.x, pointer.y);\n});\ncanvas.on('mouse:up', function(options) {\n  mouseDownPoint = null;\n});\ncanvas.on('mouse:move', function(options) {\n  if (shiftKeyDown &amp;&amp; mouseDownPoint) {\n    var pointer = canvas.getPointer(options.e, true);\n    var mouseMovePoint = new fabric.Point(pointer.x, pointer.y);\n    canvas.relativePan(mouseMovePoint.subtract(mouseDownPoint));\n    mouseDownPoint = mouseMovePoint;\n    keepPositionInBounds(canvas);\n  }\n});\nfabric.util.addListener(document.body, 'keydown', function(options) {\n  if (options.repeat) {\n    return;\n  }\n  var key = options.which || options.keyCode; // key detection\n  if (key == 16) { // handle Shift key\n    canvas.defaultCursor = 'move';\n    canvas.selection = false;\n    shiftKeyDown = true;\n  } else if (key === 37) { // handle Left key\n    move(Direction.LEFT);\n  } else if (key === 38) { // handle Up key\n    move(Direction.UP);\n  } else if (key === 39) { // handle Right key\n    move(Direction.RIGHT);\n  } else if (key === 40) { // handle Down key\n    move(Direction.DOWN);\n  }\n});\nfabric.util.addListener(document.body, 'keyup', function(options) {\n  var key = options.which || options.keyCode; // key detection\n  if (key == 16) { // handle Shift key\n    canvas.defaultCursor = 'default';\n    canvas.selection = true;\n    shiftKeyDown = false;\n  }\n});\n// jQuery('.canvas-container').on('mousewheel', function(options) {\n//   var delta = options.originalEvent.wheelDelta;\n//   if (delta != 0) {\n//     var pointer = canvas.getPointer(options.e, true);\n//     var point = new fabric.Point(pointer.x, pointer.y);\n//     if (delta &gt; 0) {\n//       zoomIn(point);\n//     } else if (delta &lt; 0) {\n//       zoomOut(point);\n//     }\n//   }\n// });\n\nfunction move(direction) {\n  switch (direction) {\n    case Direction.LEFT:\n      canvas.relativePan(new fabric.Point(-10 * canvas.getZoom(), 0));\n      break;\n    case Direction.UP:\n      canvas.relativePan(new fabric.Point(0, -10 * canvas.getZoom()));\n      break;\n    case Direction.RIGHT:\n      canvas.relativePan(new fabric.Point(10 * canvas.getZoom(), 0));\n      break;\n    case Direction.DOWN:\n      canvas.relativePan(new fabric.Point(0, 10 * canvas.getZoom()));\n      break;\n  }\n  keepPositionInBounds(canvas);\n}\n\n\n// function zoomIn(point) {\n//   if (zoomLevel &lt; zoomLevelMax) {\n//     zoomLevel++;\n//     canvas.zoomToPoint(point, Math.pow(2, zoomLevel));\n//     keepPositionInBounds(canvas);\n//   }\n// }\n\n// function zoomOut(point) {\n//   console.log(zoomLevel, zoomLevelMin);\n//   if (zoomLevel &gt; zoomLevelMin) {\n//     zoomLevel--;\n//     canvas.zoomToPoint(point, Math.pow(2, zoomLevel));\n//     keepPositionInBounds(canvas);\n//   }\n// }\n\nfunction keepPositionInBounds() {\n  var zoom = canvas.getZoom();\n  var xMin = (2 - zoom) * canvas.getWidth() / 2;\n  var xMax = zoom * canvas.getWidth() / 2;\n  var yMin = (2 - zoom) * canvas.getHeight() / 2;\n  var yMax = zoom * canvas.getHeight() / 2;\n\n  var point = new fabric.Point(canvas.getWidth() / 2, canvas.getHeight() / 2);\n  var center = fabric.util.transformPoint(point, canvas.viewportTransform);\n\n  var clampedCenterX = clamp(center.x, xMin, xMax);\n  var clampedCenterY = clamp(center.y, yMin, yMax);\n\n  var diffX = clampedCenterX - center.x;\n  var diffY = clampedCenterY - center.y;\n\n  if (diffX != 0 || diffY != 0) {\n    canvas.relativePan(new fabric.Point(diffX, diffY));\n  }\n}\n\nfunction clamp(value, min, max) {\n  return Math.max(min, Math.min(value, max));\n}</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-css lang-css prettyprint-override\"><code>#c {\n  background-color: grey;\n  margin-top: 10px;\n}\n\nbutton {\n  padding: 10px 20px;\n}</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-html lang-html prettyprint-override\"><code>&lt;script src=\"https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/fabric.js/3.1.0/fabric.min.js\"&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n&lt;script src=\"https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/jquery/2.1.3/jquery.min.js\"&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n&lt;button id=\"door\"&gt;Door&lt;/button&gt;\n&lt;button id=\"delete\"&gt;Delete Door&lt;/button&gt;\n&lt;button id=\"save\"&gt;Save&lt;/button&gt;\n&lt;button id=\"getid\"&gt;GET ID&lt;/button&gt;\n&lt;button id=\"btnResetZoom\"&gt;Reset Zoom&lt;/button&gt;\n\n&lt;canvas id=\"c\" width=\"800\" height=\"800\"&gt;&lt;/canvas&gt;\n&lt;br&gt;  \n&lt;p class=\"save\"&gt;\n&lt;/p&gt;</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":225,"question_id":65022166,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>When i tried the below code i got the response in binary as shown in the image link. I need to download this data into zip folder. Could anyone help me with this.</p>\n<pre><code>\n    const blobServiceClient = new BlobServiceClient(`https://${account}.blob.core.windows.net${sas}`);\n     \n    async function download() {\n      const containerClient = blobServiceClient.getContainerClient(containerName);\n      const blobClient = containerClient.getBlobClient(blobName);\n     \n      // Get blob content from position 0 to the end\n      // In browsers, get downloaded data by accessing downloadBlockBlobResponse.blobBody\n      const downloadBlockBlobResponse = await blobClient.download();\n      const downloaded = await blobToString(await downloadBlockBlobResponse.blobBody);\n     \n      console.log(&quot;Downloaded blob content&quot;, downloaded);\n     \n      // [Browsers only] A helper method used to convert a browser Blob into string.\n      async function blobToString(blob) {\n        const fileReader = new FileReader();\n        return new Promise((resolve, reject) =&gt; {\n          fileReader.onloadend = (ev) =&gt; {\n            resolve(ev.target.result);\n          };\n          fileReader.onerror = reject;\n          fileReader.readAsText(blob);\n        });\n      }\n    }\n\n</code></pre>\n<p><a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/eBEAw.png\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">OutputData</a></p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":226,"question_id":65022161,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>I'm pretty new to React Native and Google Firebase, my question may be quite difficult to understand due to my little knowledge, but here is my best shot.</p>\n<p>I'm making a advanced To-Do app and I'm saving all the data (what the user inputs like Take Dog On Walk (example)) too google firebase so when the app is fully closed it can then be opened and restored with all the users to-do items. My question is, does google firebase keep its data all together so if i have two separate people on two different devices, and Person1 puts Wash Dishes, and Person2 puts Walk Dog, will Walk Dog and Wash Dishes show up for Person1 and Person2, how can i make it so its stores the data only for that device, and displays Wash Dishes for only Person1, but also store Person2's data but just for him?</p>\n<p>sorry if this is a really obvious answer like it automatically does it etc,</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":231,"question_id":65022062,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>So I've coded this react small react form specifically for this question and I want to add a feature to it.</p>\n<p>Here's the code:</p>\n<pre><code>import React, { useState } from &quot;react&quot;;\n\nexport default function App() {\n  const [formInfo, setFormInfo] = useState({ name: &quot;&quot;, email: &quot;&quot; });\n\n  function onch(e) {\n    const { value, id } = e.target;\n\n    id === &quot;name&quot;\n      ? setFormInfo({ ...formInfo, name: value })\n      : setFormInfo({ ...setFormInfo, email: value });\n  }\n\n  function onsub(e) {\n    e.preventDefault();\n\n    const { name, email } = formInfo;\n\n    if (name === &quot;&quot;) {\n      alert(&quot;fill your name&quot;);\n    } else if (email === &quot;&quot;) {\n      alert(&quot;fill out your email&quot;);\n    } else {\n      alert(&quot;done&quot;);\n      setFormInfo({ name: &quot;&quot;, email: &quot;&quot; });\n    }\n  }\n\n  const { name, email } = formInfo;\n\n  return (\n    &lt;form action=&quot;&quot; onSubmit={onsub}&gt;\n      &lt;div className=&quot;input&quot;&gt;\n        &lt;label htmlFor=&quot;&quot;&gt;Name&lt;/label&gt;\n        &lt;input type=&quot;text&quot; name=&quot;&quot; id=&quot;name&quot; onChange={onch} value={name} /&gt;\n      &lt;/div&gt;\n      &lt;div className=&quot;input&quot;&gt;\n        &lt;label htmlFor=&quot;&quot;&gt;E-mail&lt;/label&gt;\n        &lt;input type=&quot;text&quot; name=&quot;&quot; id=&quot;email&quot; onChange={onch} value={email} /&gt;\n      &lt;/div&gt;\n\n      &lt;div className=&quot;input&quot;&gt;\n        &lt;button type=&quot;submit&quot;&gt;Submit&lt;/button&gt;\n      &lt;/div&gt;\n    &lt;/form&gt;\n  );\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>You see if you didn't fill out one of the inputs it will trigger an alert. {"body":"<p>I have created a React Native app and want a function where the user can specify in which city they live so that it can be shown to other users. It should be a text input where the user can search for a city and get a dropdown of choices to choose from. The city should then preferably be saved as an ID in our database that can be converted back to a localized version of the city for all users. Let's say someone lives in the UK it should say Gothenburg and if you live in Sweden it should say Göteborg. I have looked at the following options but none is optimal for us:</p>\n<ul>\n<li>Google Places Autocomplete API to fetch the city, save the place ID in our database, and reverse geocode it. This becomes very expensive for us because it is a social app and each user would do approximately 20 geocoding requests when starting the app</li>\n<li>Create a database with names of cities. This is not very scalable as you need to add new entries for each new country you want to support</li>\n<li>Let users manually enter their city. This is prone to errors because users can write whatever they want</li>\n</ul>\n<p>I would be happy to receive some suggestions on how to solve this issue.</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":235,"question_id":65021946,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>Windows 10 x64, Google Chrome v87.0.4280.66.</p>\n<p>If I subscribe to my component's event via JavaScript then my event handler works fine. But if I try to do the same via attributes in the HTML-file then my event handler doesn't work.</p>\n<p>So, it works fine:</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;!DOCTYPE html&gt;\n&lt;html lang=&quot;en&quot;&gt;\n&lt;head&gt;\n    &lt;meta charset=&quot;UTF-8&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;title&gt;Custom component&lt;/title&gt;\n&lt;/head&gt;\n&lt;body&gt;\n&lt;custom-counter id=&quot;counter&quot; counter=&quot;5&quot;&gt;&lt;/custom-counter&gt;\n&lt;script src=&quot;custom-counter.js&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n&lt;/body&gt;\n&lt;/html&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p>code:</p>\n<pre><code>// custom-counter.js\n\nclass CustomCounter extends HTMLElement {\n\n    static get htmlTagName() { return &quot;custom-counter&quot;; }\n\n    constructor() {\n        super();\n    }\n\n    #shadow;\n\n    #render() {\n        console.log(&quot;#render called&quot;);\n        if(this.#shadow) {\n            this.#shadow.getElementById(&quot;counter&quot;).textContent = `* ${this.counter.toString()} *`;\n        }\n    }\n\n    get counter() {\n        const attName = &quot;counter&quot;;\n        return this.hasAttribute(attName) ? parseInt(this.getAttribute(attName)) : 0;\n    }\n\n    set counter(value) {\n        const attName = &quot;counter&quot;;\n        this.setAttribute(attName, value);\n        this.dispatchEvent(new CustomEvent(&quot;counterchanged&quot;, {detail: { value: this.counter}}));\n    }\n\n    connectedCallback() {\n        this.#shadow = this.attachShadow({mode:&quot;closed&quot;});\n        this.#shadow.innerHTML = `&lt;div&gt;&lt;span id=&quot;counter&quot;&gt;* ${this.counter} *&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;`;\n        const element = this.#shadow.getElementById(&quot;counter&quot;);\n        element.style.background = &quot;yellow&quot;;\n        element.addEventListener(&quot;click&quot;, event =&gt; ++this.counter);\n    }\n\n    attributeChangedCallback(attName, oldValue, newValue) {\n        console.log(`The '${attName}' attribute changed. oldValue: ${oldValue}. newValue: ${newValue}`);\n        this.#render();\n    }\n\n    static get observedAttributes() {\n        return [&quot;counter&quot;, &quot;counterchanged&quot;];\n    }\n}\n\ncustomElements.whenDefined(CustomCounter.htmlTagName).then(\n    () =&gt; console.log(`'${CustomCounter.htmlTagName}' web component is defined.`));\n\nif(!customElements.get(CustomCounter.htmlTagName)) {\n    customElements.define(CustomCounter.htmlTagName, CustomCounter);\n}\n\n// It works fine:\nconst counter = document.getElementById(&quot;counter&quot;);\ncounter.addEventListener(&quot;counterchanged&quot;, event =&gt; console.log(event.detail));\n</code></pre>\n<p>It seems like this:</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/ApPfd.png\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/ApPfd.png\" alt=\"enter image description here\" /></a></p>\n<p>Console output (when I click on my web component):</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/LRaJK.png\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/LRaJK.png\" alt=\"enter image description here\" /></a></p>\n<p>Ok. Now I want to move the event registration from code to html:</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;!DOCTYPE html&gt;\n&lt;html lang=&quot;en&quot;&gt;\n&lt;head&gt;\n    &lt;meta charset=&quot;UTF-8&quot;&gt;\n    &lt;title&gt;Custom component&lt;/title&gt;\n&lt;/head&gt;\n&lt;body&gt;\n&lt;custom-counter id=&quot;counter&quot; counter=&quot;5&quot; oncounterchanged=&quot;console.log(event.detail)&quot;&gt;&lt;/custom-counter&gt;\n&lt;script src=&quot;custom-counter.js&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n&lt;/body&gt;\n&lt;/html&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p>code:</p>\n<pre><code>// custom-counter.js\n\nclass CustomCounter extends HTMLElement {\n\n    static get htmlTagName() { return &quot;custom-counter&quot;; }\n\n    constructor() {\n        super();\n    }\n\n    #shadow;\n\n    #render() {\n        console.log(&quot;#render called&quot;);\n        if(this.#shadow) {\n            this.#shadow.getElementById(&quot;counter&quot;).textContent = `* ${this.counter.toString()} *`;\n        }\n    }\n\n    get counter() {\n        const attName = &quot;counter&quot;;\n        return this.hasAttribute(attName) ? parseInt(this.getAttribute(attName)) : 0;\n    }\n\n    set counter(value) {\n        const attName = &quot;counter&quot;;\n        this.setAttribute(attName, value);\n        this.dispatchEvent(new CustomEvent(&quot;counterchanged&quot;, {detail: { value: this.counter}}));\n    }\n\n    connectedCallback() {\n        this.#shadow = this.attachShadow({mode:&quot;closed&quot;});\n        this.#shadow.innerHTML = `&lt;div&gt;&lt;span id=&quot;counter&quot;&gt;* ${this.counter} *&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;`;\n        const element = this.#shadow.getElementById(&quot;counter&quot;);\n        element.style.background = &quot;yellow&quot;;\n        element.addEventListener(&quot;click&quot;, event =&gt; ++this.counter);\n    }\n\n    attributeChangedCallback(attName, oldValue, newValue) {\n        console.log(`The '${attName}' attribute changed. oldValue: ${oldValue}. newValue: ${newValue}`);\n        this.#render();\n    }\n\n    static get observedAttributes() {\n        return [&quot;counter&quot;, &quot;counterchanged&quot;];\n    }\n}\n\ncustomElements.whenDefined(CustomCounter.htmlTagName).then(\n    () =&gt; console.log(`'${CustomCounter.htmlTagName}' web component is defined.`));\n\nif(!customElements.get(CustomCounter.htmlTagName)) {\n    customElements.define(CustomCounter.htmlTagName, CustomCounter);\n}\n\n// It works fine:\n/* const counter = document.getElementById(&quot;counter&quot;);\ncounter.addEventListener(&quot;counterchanged&quot;, event =&gt; console.log(event.detail));\n*/\n</code></pre>\n<p>But now my event handler doesn't work:</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/zXelH.png\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/zXelH.png\" alt=\"enter image description here\" /></a></p>\n<p>Why does it happen and how can I fix it?</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":240,"question_id":65021852,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>I'm trying to implement a simple form validation, but I can't make it work with parameters somehow.</p>\n<p>This is the code for just one input:</p>\n<pre class=\"lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>const firstName = document.getElementById(&quot;first-name&quot;);\nconst nameRegex = /^[a-zA-Z]{2,15}$/;\nfirstName.addEventListener(&quot;blur&quot;, validate(firstName));\n\nfunction validate(id) {\n    let re = &quot;&quot;;\n    switch (id) {\n        case firstName:\n            re = nameRegex;\n            break;\n        case lastName:\n            re = nameRegex;\n            break;\n        case email:\n            re = emailRegex;\n            break;\n        case password:\n            re = passwordRegex;\n            break;\n    }\n\n    if (!re.test(id.value)) {\n        id.parentElement.classList.add(&quot;error&quot;);\n        id.parentElement.nextElementSibling.classList.remove(&quot;hide&quot;);\n    } else {\n        id.parentElement.classList.remove(&quot;error&quot;);\n        id.parentElement.nextElementSibling.classList.add(&quot;hide&quot;);\n    }\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>It looks like the code can't tap into the id.value field.</p>\n<p>For reference this code works fine:</p>\n<pre class=\"lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>function validateFirstName() {\n    if (!nameRegex.test(firstName.value)) {\n        firstName.parentElement.classList.add(&quot;error&quot;);\n        firstName.parentElement.nextElementSibling.classList.remove(&quot;hide&quot;);\n    } else {\n        firstName.parentElement.classList.remove(&quot;error&quot;);\n        firstName.parentElement.nextElementSibling.classList.add(&quot;hide&quot;);\n    }\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>Can anyone point me in the right direction? {"body":"<p>I want to draw a curve in JavaScript with the HTML5-Canvas.</p>\n<p>But since Strokes can not interpolate between the width of two points I need to manually interpolate the width depending on the pointpressure.</p>\n<p>Here is my current implementation:</p>\n<pre class=\"lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>\n  private drawsmooth(p1: Point, p2: Point, tool: DrawingTool): void {\n    this.context.beginPath();\n    if (this.midpoint !== undefined) {\n      this.context.moveTo(this.midpoint.x, this.midpoint.y);\n    } else {\n      this.context.moveTo(p1.x, p1.y);\n    }\n    \n      this.midpoint = calcMidpoint(p1, p2);\n      this.context.lineWidth = tool.width * p1.pressure; // here I want to interpolate between the \n                                                         // pressure of p1 and p2 \n      this.context.quadraticCurveTo(p1.x, p1.y, this.midpoint.x, this.midpoint.y);\n      this.context.stroke();\n    \n  }\n\n</code></pre>\n<p>Which results in this type of stroke:\n<a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/HbY6q.png\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/HbY6q.png\" alt=\"enter image description here\" /></a></p>\n<p>What I want:</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/EUSLX.png\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/EUSLX.png\" alt=\"enter image description here\" /></a></p>\n<p>What I tried:</p>\n<p>I wanted to manually loop through each point depending on the &quot;t&quot; factor.\nAnd get multiple points on the curve, which I then redraw.</p>\n<pre><code>   getQBezierCoordinate(t:number, p1:number, p2:number, p3:number) {\n    const pos = 1 - t;\n    return pos * pos * p1 + 2 * pos * t * p2 + t * t * p3;\n  }\n\n   getQuadraticCurvePoint(p1:Point, cp: Point, p2:Point, t:number) {\n    const innterpolatedPressure = p1.pressure + t * (p2.pressure - p1.pressure);\n    return {\n      x:  this.getQBezierCoordinate(t, p1.x, cp.x, p2.x),\n      y:  this.getQBezierCoordinate(t, p1.y, cp.y, p2.y),\n      pressure: innterpolatedPressure\n    };\n  }\n\n  private drawsmooth(p1: Point, p2: Point, tool: DrawingTool): void {\n    let start: Point;\n    if (this.midpoint !== undefined) {\n      this.context.moveTo(this.midpoint.x, this.midpoint.y);\n      start = this.midpoint;\n    } else {\n      this.context.moveTo(p1.x, p1.y);\n      start = p1;\n    }\n\n    \n      this.midpoint = calcMidpoint(p1,p2);\n      const density = 0.1;\n      for(let i = 0; i&lt;=1; i+= density){\n        const pq1 = i === 0 ? start : this.getQuadraticCurvePoint(start,p1,this.midpoint,i);\n        const pq2 = this.getQuadraticCurvePoint(start,p1,this.midpoint,i+density);\n        this.context.beginPath();\n        this.context.moveTo(pq1.x,pq1.y);\n        this.context.lineTo(pq2.x,pq2.y);\n        this.context.lineWidth = tool.width * ((pq1.pressure+pq2.pressure)/2);\n        this.context.stroke();\n      }\n    \n  }\n\n</code></pre>\n<p>Which results in the following:</p>\n<p><a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/u10Bt.png\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/u10Bt.png\" alt=\"enter image description here\" /></a></p>\n<p>So is there any way to interpolate between stroke ends?\nIt would also to be ok to create a shape with valid points.</p>\n<p>The issue is, it seems like some points are somehow &quot;skipped&quot; or thrown of, by the angle.</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":249,"question_id":65021658,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>I have a Vue component that lists maintenance requests from the database.</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;template&gt;\n    &lt;div&gt;\n      {{ maintenance_requests }}\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;/template&gt;\n\n&lt;script&gt;\n\nimport { mapGetters, mapActions } from 'vuex'\n\nexport default {\n\n\n    computed: {\n        ...mapGetters({\n            maintenance_requests: 'maintenance/maintenances',\n        }),\n\n\n    },\n\n    methods: {\n        ...mapActions({\n            getMaintenanceRequests: 'maintenance/getMaintenanceRequests',\n        }),\n\n    },\n\n    mounted () {\n        this.getMaintenanceRequests()\n\n\n    }\n\n}\n&lt;/script&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p>This is my Vuex store</p>\n<pre><code>import axios from 'axios'\n\nexport default {\n\n    namespaced: true,\n\n    state:{\n       maintenance_requests: [],\n   },\n\n   getters:{\n       maintenances (state) {\n            return state.maintenance_requests.sort((a,b) =&gt; b.date_created - a.date_created)\n        },\n\n   mutations:{\n       PUSH_MAINTENANCES (state, data) {\n            state.maintenance_requests.push(...data)\n        },\n\n   actions:{\n\n      async getMaintenanceRequests ({ commit }) {\n            let response = await axios.get('/api/maintenance/requests')\n\n            commit('PUSH_MAINTENANCES', response.data.data)\n        }\n     }\n\n},\n\n</code></pre>\n<p>The above code outputs a list of maintenances as follows:</p>\n<pre><code>{&quot;maintenance_id&quot;: 1, &quot;type&quot;: &quot;Water problems&quot;, &quot;Description&quot;: &quot;I have had no water for 2 days now&quot; {"body":"<p>Problem: I have  the following construct in my html code (See also: <a href=\"https://jsfiddle.net/abmhxgov/20/\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://jsfiddle.net/abmhxgov/20/</a>)</p>\n<p>Html:</p>\n<pre><code>&lt;div class=&quot;form-group &quot;&gt;\n      &lt;div id=&quot;click-area&quot; class=&quot;form-group-switch &quot; onclick=&quot;radioClick(event)&quot;&gt;\n        &lt;div&gt;Slider&lt;/div&gt;\n        &lt;label id=&quot;label-1&quot; class=&quot;switch&quot;&gt;\n          &lt;input id=&quot;checkbox&quot; type=&quot;checkbox&quot; data-submit-id=&quot;&quot; data-submit-as=&quot;&quot; data-value-type=&quot;switch&quot; onclick=&quot;rPP(event)&quot;&gt;\n          &lt;span id=&quot;slider-span&quot; class=&quot;slider round&quot;&gt;&lt;/span&gt;\n        &lt;/label&gt;\n      &lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;/div&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p>The expected behaviour is that if I click anywhere inside the &quot;click-area&quot; the underlying checkbox should be checked/unchecked.\nThis does work as long as I am clicking on the &quot;click-area&quot; excluding the &quot;slider-span&quot;. If I click on the &quot;slider-span&quot; the event gets fired as I see the log from it, but the slider doesn't change it css appearance.</p>\n<p>The problem is that the checkbox itself shouldn't be clickable at all from the user since it is not visible via CSS (no height/width) and if a click on the slider happens it's either on &quot;label-1&quot; or &quot;slider-span&quot; and shouldn't be propagated to &quot;checkbox&quot; at all or am I wrong? Since &quot;checkbox&quot; and &quot;slider-span&quot; are on the same level and events only get propagated upwards not sideways?</p>\n<p>(Note: I am aware that a click will happen when the event moves along the tree up. Thats where the function <code>rPP(event)</code> comes into play to prevent a endless loop)</p>\n<p>The following questions are a mystery to me:\nHow is the click event handled on the checkbox? Does it consume the click event or not? I assume it does not because if <code>rPP()</code> is removed I get a double click on the element but I would expect a endless loop in this case because if the event is not consumed it would travel upwards till it basically restarts itself and so on?</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>function radioClick(event) {\n  console.log(\"event\")\n  event.stopPropagation();\n  var a = $(event.currentTarget).find(\"input\");\n  a.prop(\"checked\", !a.prop(\"checked\"));\n}\n\nfunction rPP(event) {\n  event.stopPropagation();\n}</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-css lang-css prettyprint-override\"><code>/* The switch - the box around the slider */\n\n.switch {\n  position: relative;\n  display: inline-block;\n  width: 4rem;\n  height: 2rem;\n}\n\n\n/* Hide default HTML checkbox */\n\n.switch input {\n  opacity: 0;\n  width: 0;\n  height: 0;\n}\n\n\n/* The slider */\n\n.slider {\n  position: absolute;\n  cursor: pointer;\n  top: 0;\n  left: 0;\n  right: 0;\n  bottom: 0;\n  background-color: #ccc;\n  -webkit-transition: 0.4s;\n  transition: 0.4s;\n}\n\n.slider::before {\n  position: absolute;\n  content: \"\";\n  height: 1.5rem;\n  width: 1.5rem;\n  left: 0.5rem;\n  bottom: 0.25rem;\n  background-color: white;\n  -webkit-transition: 0.4s;\n  transition: 0.4s;\n}\n\ninput:checked+.slider {\n  background-color: #2196F3;\n}\n\ninput:focus+.slider {\n  box-shadow: 0 0 0.1rem #2196F3;\n}\n\ninput:checked+.slider::before {\n  -webkit-transform: translateX(1.5rem);\n  -ms-transform: translateX(1.5rem);\n  transform: translateX(1.5rem);\n}\n\n\n/* Rounded sliders */\n\n.slider.round {\n  border-radius: 2rem;\n}\n\n.slider.round::before {\n  border-radius: 50%;\n}\n\n\n/* === &lt; slider ================================================================================= */\n\n.form-group {\n  display: grid;\n  grid-template-columns: 100%;\n  grid-template-rows: 2;\n}\n\n.form-group-switch {\n  background-color: lightgray;\n  border-radius: 0.5rem;\n  font-weight: bold;\n}</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-html lang-html prettyprint-override\"><code>&lt;script src=\"https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/jquery/3.3.1/jquery.min.js\"&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\n&lt;div class=\"form-group \"&gt;\n  &lt;div id=\"click-area\" class=\"form-group-switch \" onclick=\"radioClick(event)\"&gt;\n    &lt;div&gt;Slider&lt;/div&gt;\n    &lt;label id=\"label-1\" class=\"switch\"&gt;\n              &lt;input id=\"checkbox\" type=\"checkbox\" data-submit-id=\"\" data-submit-as=\"\" data-value-type=\"switch\" onclick=\"rPP(event)\"&gt;\n              &lt;span id=\"slider-span\" class=\"slider round\"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;\n            &lt;/label&gt;\n  &lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;/div&gt;</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":267,"question_id":65021361,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I'm trying to create a file upload for STL files. The code below works as in that in the onDrop function the console.log shows an empty array for all other file types and the files if they are of type STL. So it does what it's supposed to do.</p>\n<p>However the line</p>\n<pre><code>{isDragReject &amp;&amp; 'File type not accepted, sorry!'}\n</code></pre>\n<p>always fires, even for stl files. Which certainly would confuse the user.</p>\n<pre><code>import React, { useCallback } from 'react';\nimport Dropzone, { useDropzone } from 'react-dropzone';\n\nconst FileDropzone = () =&gt; {\nconst maxSize = 100000000;\n\nconst onDrop = useCallback((acceptedFiles) =&gt; {\n    console.log(acceptedFiles);\n}, []);\n\nconst {\n    isDragActive,\n    getRootProps,\n    getInputProps,\n    isDragReject,\n    acceptedFiles,\n    rejectedFiles,\n} = useDropzone({\n    onDrop,\n    accept: '.stl',\n    minSize: 0,\n    maxSize,\n});\n\nconst isFileTooLarge =\n    rejectedFiles &amp;&amp;\n    rejectedFiles.length &gt; 0 &amp;&amp;\n    rejectedFiles[0].size &gt; maxSize;\n\nreturn (\n    &lt;div className=&quot;container text-center mt-5&quot;&gt;\n        &lt;div {...getRootProps()}&gt;\n            &lt;input {...getInputProps()} /&gt;\n            {!isDragActive &amp;&amp; 'Click here or drop a file to upload!'}\n            {isDragActive &amp;&amp; !isDragReject &amp;&amp; &quot;Drop it like it's hot!&quot;}\n            {isDragReject &amp;&amp; 'File type not accepted, sorry!'}\n            {isFileTooLarge &amp;&amp; (\n                &lt;div className=&quot;text-danger mt-2&quot;&gt;File is too large.&lt;/div&gt;\n            )}\n        &lt;/div&gt;\n    &lt;/div&gt;\n);\n};\n\nexport default FileDropzone;\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":268,"question_id":65021360,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},

{"body":"<p>I make a schema thats makes simplicity for understanding my Problem, My original schema looks like this.</p>\n<pre><code>{\n    receiver:&quot;b&quot;\n    sender: &quot;a&quot;\n    text: &quot;hi&quot;\n    createdAt:2020-11-18T09:42:45.387+00:00\n}\n\n{\n    receiver:&quot;b&quot;\n    sender: &quot;a&quot;\n    text: &quot;by&quot;\n    createdAt:2020-11-19T09:42:45.387+00:00\n}\n{\n    receiver:&quot;c&quot;\n    sender: &quot;a&quot;\n    text: &quot;How Ara you&quot;\n    createdAt:2020-11-18T09:42:45.387+00:00\n}\n{\n    receiver:&quot;b&quot;\n    sender: &quot;d&quot;\n    text: &quot;What is Cost of this product&quot;\n    createdAt:2020-11-18T09:42:45.387+00:00\n}\n{\n    receiver:&quot;b&quot;\n    sender: &quot;a&quot;\n    text: &quot;Im Good&quot;\n    createdAt:2020-11-20T09:42:45.387+00:00\n}\n\n</code></pre>\n<p>How to make Inbox Chat from this Schema for Active user.</p>\n<p>For Example the Active user is <strong>a</strong> so I want to make Inbox for this user.</p>\n<p><strong>Already Try</strong></p>\n<pre><code>\nChat.aggregate([\n        {   $or :[\n                {sender : &quot;a&quot;},\n                {reciver : &quot;a&quot;},\n            ]\n        },\n        { $group: { sender:  &quot;a&quot; } }\n        \n    ])\n    .then((chats)=&gt;{\n        return res.send({\n            success: true,\n            chats\n        })\n    }).catch((error)=&gt;{\n        res.status(400).send({\n            success: false,\n            message: error.message\n        })\n\n    })\n\n\n\n</code></pre>\n<p>Thanks in Advance.</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":270,"question_id":65021302,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>In my application I have 2 columns, left side are the controls and right side are the settings of these controls, on of the settings is set by an NgbDropdown. So I have this issue with my NgbDropdown where it gets clipped by the column next to it like so:<a href=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/KmXLT.png\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\"><img src=\"https://i.stack.imgur.com/KmXLT.png\" alt=\"enter image description here\" /></a></p>\n<p>The position is set to absolute and also tried to set the z-index higher than the left column, which didn't work. I have also tried the container=&quot;body&quot; solution, which actually does the job but then the dropdown doesn't stick to the inputfield (floats when you start scrolling). {"body":"<p>I have this code which sould toggle between elements, if user opens the element all other elements should close and that works, but if I click on the same element multiple times nothing happens and I cant figure out why. I need some help.</p>\n<p>Here is my code:</p>\n<pre><code>const heads = [...document.querySelectorAll(&quot;.head&quot;)];\nconst dropdowns = [...document.querySelectorAll(&quot;.head-dropdown&quot;)];\nconst activate_filter = document.getElementById(&quot;filter-btn&quot;);\n\nlet isActive = false;\nlet isFilterActive = false;\nlet queue = [];\n\nif (!isFilterActive) {\n  dropdowns.forEach((val, i) =&gt; {\n    val\n      .querySelector(&quot;.dropdown-search&quot;)\n      .setAttribute(\n        &quot;name&quot;,\n        `${heads[i].querySelector(&quot;p&quot;).textContent}-search`\n      );\n  });\n}\n\nactivate_filter.addEventListener(&quot;click&quot;, e =&gt; {\n  dropdowns.forEach((val, i) =&gt; {\n    val.classList.remove(&quot;activated&quot;);\n    val.dataset.isActivated = false;\n  });\n  if (!isFilterActive) {\n    heads.forEach((val, i) =&gt; {\n      const p = val.children[0];\n      p.innerHTML += `&lt;i class='eos-icons'&gt;arrow_drop_down&lt;/i&gt;`;\n      val.addEventListener(&quot;click&quot;, handleEventAll);\n      val.style.cursor = &quot;pointer&quot;;\n    });\n    isFilterActive = true;\n  } else {\n    heads.forEach(val =&gt; {\n      const p = val.children[0];\n      const i = p.querySelector(&quot;i&quot;);\n      if (i) {\n        i.remove();\n      }\n\n      val.removeEventListener(&quot;click&quot;, handleEventAll);\n      val.style.cursor = &quot;default&quot;;\n    });\n    isFilterActive = false;\n  }\n});\n\nfunction handleEventAll(e) {\n  const test = e.target.querySelector(&quot;.head-dropdown&quot;);\n  test.classList.add(&quot;activated&quot;);\n  queue.unshift(test);\n  if (queue.length &gt; 3) {\n    queue.pop();\n  }\n\n  dropdowns.forEach((val, i) =&gt; {\n    if (!val.dataset) {\n      val.dataset.isActivated = false;\n    }\n    let t = eval(queue[0].dataset.isActivated);\n    console.log(t);\n    if (t) {\n      console.log(&quot;in true&quot;, queue[0]);\n      queue[0].dataset.isActivated = true;\n      queue[0].classList.toggle(&quot;activated&quot;);\n      queue.pop();\n    } else {\n      console.log(&quot;in false&quot;, queue[0].dataset);\n      queue[0].dataset.isActivated = false;\n      console.log(queue);\n      queue[1].classList.remove(&quot;activated&quot;);\n\n      queue.pop();\n    }\n  });\n}\n\nwindow.addEventListener(&quot;click&quot;, e =&gt; {"body":"<p>I am working on a speed writing application. In that application I want to include the possibility to select different word lists.</p>\n<p>My problem is how I can select the variable for the word list.</p>\n<p>This is the way it works without a word list selection:</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>window.addEventListener('load', init);\n\n\nlet messagegameover;\nmessagegameover = \"&lt;span style='color:#ff0000'&gt;Game over!&lt;/span&gt;\"; // store the string\n\nlet messagecorrect;\nmessagecorrect = \"&lt;span style='color:green'&gt;Correct!!&lt;/span&gt;\";\n\n//**************\n\nconst select = document.getElementById(\"language-select\");\nconst textSpan = document.getElementById(\"text-span\");\nconst valueSpan = document.getElementById(\"value-span\");\n\nfunction showTextAndValue(select, textSpan, valueSpan) {\n  const option = select.options[select.selectedIndex];\n  if (option) {\n    textSpan.textContent = option.text;\n    valueSpan.textContent = option.value;\n  } else {\n    // No option is selected\n    textSpan.textContent = \"\";\n    valueSpan.textContent = \"\";\n  }\n}\n\n// Show on page load\nshowTextAndValue(select, textSpan, valueSpan);\n\n// Hook the `input` event\nselect.addEventListener(\"input\", () =&gt; {\n  // Update the contents of the elements\n  showTextAndValue(select, textSpan, valueSpan);\n});\n\n//**********************\n\n// Schwierigkeitsgrad\nconst levels = {\n  easy: 5,\n  medium: 3,\n  hard: 2\n}\n\n// Auswahl des Schwierigkeitsgrads\nconst currentLevel = levels.easy;\n\n// Globale Variablen\nlet time = currentLevel;\nlet score = 0;\nlet isPlaying;\n\n// DOM-Elemente\nconst wordInput = document.querySelector('#word-input');\nconst currentWord = document.querySelector('#current-word');\nconst scoreDisplay = document.querySelector('#score');\nconst timeDisplay = document.querySelector('#time');\nconst message = document.querySelector('#message');\nconst seconds = document.querySelector('#seconds');\n\nconst wordsdeu = [\n  'Hund', 'Katze', 'Maus'\n];\n\nconst wordseng = [\n  'dog', 'cat', 'mouse'\n];\n\n// Spielstart\nfunction init() {\n  // Zahl in Sekunden anzeigen\n  seconds.innerHTML = currentLevel;\n  // Lade Wörter aus Array\n  showWord(wordseng); //replace wordseng by valueSpan\n  // Worteingabe prüfen\n  wordInput.addEventListener('input', startMatch);\n  // Countdown Sekunden\n  setInterval(countdown, 1000);\n  // Spielstatus\n  setInterval(checkStatus, 50);\n}\n\n// Wortgleichzeit prüfen\nfunction startMatch() {\n  if (matchWords()) {\n    isPlaying = true;\n    time = currentLevel + 1;\n    showWord(wordseng); //replace wordseng by valueSpan\n    wordInput.value = '';\n    score++;\n  }\n  // wenn score &lt;0, dann 0\n  if (score === -1) {\n    scoreDisplay.innerHTML = 0;\n  } else {\n    scoreDisplay.innerHTML = score;\n  }\n\n}\n\n// prüfen ob Wörter gleich\nfunction matchWords() {\n  if (wordInput.value === currentWord.innerHTML) {\n    message.innerHTML = messagecorrect;\n    return true;\n  } else {\n    message.innerHTML = ' ';\n    return false;\n  }\n}\n\n\n\n// zufällige Wortanzeige\nfunction showWord(wordseng) { //replace wordseng by valueSpan\n  // zufälliges Array für Index\n  const randIndex = Math.floor(Math.random() * wordseng.length); //replace wordseng by valueSpan\n  // zufälliges Wort\n  currentWord.innerHTML = wordseng[randIndex]; //replace wordseng by valueSpan\n}\n\n// timer\nfunction countdown() {\n  // prüfen, ob Zeit abgelaufen\n  if (time &gt; 0) {\n    // abnehmend\n    time--;\n  } else if (time === 0) {\n    // Spielende\n    isPlaying = false;\n  }\n  // Restzeit\n  timeDisplay.innerHTML = time;\n}\n\nfunction checkStatus() {\n  if (!isPlaying &amp;&amp; time === 0) {\n    //message.innerHTML = 'Game Over!!!';\n    message.innerHTML = messagegameover;\n    score = -1;\n  }\n}</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-html lang-html prettyprint-override\"><code>  &lt;label for=\"language\"&gt;Choose a language:&lt;/label&gt;\n  &lt;select name=\"language\" id=\"language-select\" value=\"wordsdeu\"&gt;\n    &lt;option value=\"wordseng\"&gt;English&lt;/option&gt;\n    &lt;option value=\"wordsdeu\"&gt;Deutsch&lt;/option&gt;\n  &lt;/select&gt;\n\n  &lt;p&gt;The following two lines are for testing purposes only&lt;/p&gt;\n  &lt;p&gt;You selected: &lt;span id=\"text-span\"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\n  &lt;p&gt;You selected the following option: &lt;span id=\"value-span\"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\n  &lt;!-- strange behaviour: does not work if I remove the line before --&gt;\n\n  &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\n  &lt;p class=\"maxtimetext\"&gt;Max. time to write this word:\n    &lt;span class=\"maxtime\" id=\"seconds\"&gt;&lt;/span&gt; Seconds&lt;/p&gt;\n  &lt;br&gt;\n\n  &lt;h2 id=\"current-word\"&gt;hello&lt;/h2&gt;\n  &lt;input type=\"text\" spellcheck=\"false\" placeholder=\"Start typing...\" id=\"word-input\" autofocus&gt;\n  &lt;h4 class=\"message\" id=\"message\"&gt;&lt;/h4&gt;\n  &lt;br&gt;\n  &lt;h3&gt;Time Left: &lt;span class=\"time-left\" id=\"time\"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\n  &lt;br&gt;\n  &lt;p class=\"score\"&gt;Score: &lt;span id=\"score\"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\n  &lt;br&gt;\n\n  &lt;p&gt;Game over? To restart just type the word!&lt;/p&gt;\n\n  &lt;script src=\"./script.js\"&gt;&lt;/script&gt;</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n<p>The following snippet shows my desired code that is apparently faulty:</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>window.addEventListener('load', init);\n\n\nlet messagegameover;\nmessagegameover = \"&lt;span style='color:#ff0000'&gt;Game over!&lt;/span&gt;\"; // store the string\n\nlet messagecorrect;\nmessagecorrect = \"&lt;span style='color:green'&gt;Correct!!&lt;/span&gt;\";\n\n//**************\n\nconst select = document.getElementById(\"language-select\");\nconst textSpan = document.getElementById(\"text-span\");\nconst valueSpan = document.getElementById(\"value-span\");\n\nfunction showTextAndValue(select, textSpan, valueSpan) {\n  const option = select.options[select.selectedIndex];\n  if (option) {\n    textSpan.textContent = option.text;\n    valueSpan.textContent = option.value;\n  } else {\n    // No option is selected\n    textSpan.textContent = \"\";\n    valueSpan.textContent = \"\";\n  }\n}\n\n// Show on page load\nshowTextAndValue(select, textSpan, valueSpan);\n\n// Hook the `input` event\nselect.addEventListener(\"input\", () =&gt; {\n  // Update the contents of the elements\n  showTextAndValue(select, textSpan, valueSpan);\n});\n\n//**********************\n\n// Schwierigkeitsgrad\nconst levels = {\n  easy: 5,\n  medium: 3,\n  hard: 2\n}\n\n// Auswahl des Schwierigkeitsgrads\nconst currentLevel = levels.easy;\n\n// Globale Variablen\nlet time = currentLevel;\nlet score = 0;\nlet isPlaying;\n\n// DOM-Elemente\nconst wordInput = document.querySelector('#word-input');\nconst currentWord = document.querySelector('#current-word');\nconst scoreDisplay = document.querySelector('#score');\nconst timeDisplay = document.querySelector('#time');\nconst message = document.querySelector('#message');\nconst seconds = document.querySelector('#seconds');\n\nconst wordsdeu = [\n  'Hund', 'Katze', 'Maus'\n];\n\nconst wordseng = [\n  'dog', 'cat', 'mouse'\n];\n\n// Spielstart\nfunction init() {\n  // Zahl in Sekunden anzeigen\n  seconds.innerHTML = currentLevel;\n  // Lade Wörter aus Array\n  showWord(valueSpan); //replace wordseng by valueSpan\n  // Worteingabe prüfen\n  wordInput.addEventListener('input', startMatch);\n  // Countdown Sekunden\n  setInterval(countdown, 1000);\n  // Spielstatus\n  setInterval(checkStatus, 50);\n}\n\n// Wortgleichzeit prüfen\nfunction startMatch() {\n  if (matchWords()) {\n    isPlaying = true;\n    time = currentLevel + 1;\n    showWord(valueSpan); //replace wordseng by valueSpan\n    wordInput.value = '';\n    score++;\n  }\n  // wenn score &lt;0, dann 0\n  if (score === -1) {\n    scoreDisplay.innerHTML = 0;\n  } else {\n    scoreDisplay.innerHTML = score;\n  }\n\n}\n\n// prüfen ob Wörter gleich\nfunction matchWords() {\n  if (wordInput.value === currentWord.innerHTML) {\n    message.innerHTML = messagecorrect;\n    return true;\n  } else {\n    message.innerHTML = ' ';\n    return false;\n  }\n}\n\n\n\n// zufällige Wortanzeige\nfunction showWord(valueSpan) { //replace wordseng by valueSpan\n  // zufälliges Array für Index\n  const randIndex = Math.floor(Math.random() * valueSpan.length); //replace wordseng by valueSpan\n  // zufälliges Wort\n  currentWord.innerHTML = valueSpan[randIndex]; //replace wordseng by valueSpan\n}\n\n// timer\nfunction countdown() {\n  // prüfen, ob Zeit abgelaufen\n  if (time &gt; 0) {\n    // abnehmend\n    time--;\n  } else if (time === 0) {\n    // Spielende\n    isPlaying = false;\n  }\n  // Restzeit\n  timeDisplay.innerHTML = time;\n}\n\nfunction checkStatus() {\n  if (!isPlaying &amp;&amp; time === 0) {\n    //message.innerHTML = 'Game Over!!!';\n    message.innerHTML = messagegameover;\n    score = -1;\n  }\n}</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-html lang-html prettyprint-override\"><code>  &lt;label for=\"language\"&gt;Choose a language:&lt;/label&gt;\n  &lt;select name=\"language\" id=\"language-select\" value=\"wordsdeu\"&gt;\n    &lt;option value=\"wordseng\"&gt;English&lt;/option&gt;\n    &lt;option value=\"wordsdeu\"&gt;Deutsch&lt;/option&gt;\n  &lt;/select&gt;\n\n  &lt;p&gt;The following two lines are for testing purposes only&lt;/p&gt;\n  &lt;p&gt;You selected: &lt;span id=\"text-span\"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\n  &lt;p&gt;You selected the following option: &lt;span id=\"value-span\"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\n  &lt;!-- strange behaviour: does not work if I remove the line before --&gt;\n\n  &lt;br&gt;&lt;br&gt;\n  &lt;p class=\"maxtimetext\"&gt;Max. time to write this word:\n    &lt;span class=\"maxtime\" id=\"seconds\"&gt;&lt;/span&gt; Seconds&lt;/p&gt;\n  &lt;br&gt;\n\n  &lt;h2 id=\"current-word\"&gt;hello&lt;/h2&gt;\n  &lt;input type=\"text\" spellcheck=\"false\" placeholder=\"Start typing...\" id=\"word-input\" autofocus&gt;\n  &lt;h4 class=\"message\" id=\"message\"&gt;&lt;/h4&gt;\n  &lt;br&gt;\n  &lt;h3&gt;Time Left: &lt;span class=\"time-left\" id=\"time\"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;\n  &lt;br&gt;\n  &lt;p class=\"score\"&gt;Score: &lt;span id=\"score\"&gt;0&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\n  &lt;br&gt;\n  &lt;p&gt;Game over? To restart just type the word!&lt;/p&gt;\n  &lt;script src=\"./script.js\"&gt;&lt;/script&gt;</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n<p>What I also observed and may have to do with the problem is that if in the following code I remove the first line, it doesn't show the second line neither, which is what I don't understand:</p>\n<pre><code> &lt;p&gt;You selected: &lt;span id=&quot;text-span&quot;&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; \n &lt;p&gt;You selected the following option: &lt;span id=&quot;value-span&quot;&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;!-- strange behaviour: does not work if I remove the line before --&gt;\n</code></pre>\n<p>I put it on JSFiddle for testing:\n<a href=\"https://jsfiddle.net/engr58wm/\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer\">https://jsfiddle.net/engr58wm/</a></p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":289,"question_id":65020934,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
